1857 Iowa City, Iowa About 22-May-1857 Israel Evans (6th H.C. Co.) 149 28 hc 11-12-Sep-1857 No official roster.

A roster of sorts has been discovered for the Israel Evans company.

The entry at the top of the roster was "List of Emigrants Shipped by

Orson Pratt Liverpool, for the Ship "Geo Washington" March 27/57

intending to Cross the Plains by Hand Carts this Season".

This list was probably done in March of 1857 of those who traveled on the ship,

George Washington and had intended to travel by handcart and the list has 154 names,

which comes close to the total of the company, which was composed of English,

Scottish, Welsh and Swiss migrants. Some names of those known to be in this company

are in this list.

The list is not complete in some believed to be in the company are not mentioned, but

then again one family who were thought to be in the company, the Brightons came to America

earlier on the Clara Wheeler in 1854 and were not mentioned since this list has only those from

the George Washington who were to go by handcart. The other handcart companies in 1857

were primarily Scandinavian and they came over on the ship Westmoreland.

Martin (1st Wagon Co.) 192 34 12-Sep-1857 No roster Iowa City, Iowa About 15-Jun-1857 Mathias Cowley (2) Scandinavian Co. 198 31 13-Sep-1857 No roster

From Our Pioneer Heritage Vol. 12

April 25th [1857] The Westmoreland sailed from Liverpool, England, with 544 Saints, mostly Scandinavians, under the direction of Matthias Cowley. It arrived at Philadelphia May 31st. The emigrants reached Iowa City by rail June 9th.

See the Westmoreland roster for names of those who may have traveled in this company. Although it seems that some went with the Christian Christiansen hand cart company.

1867 North Platte, Nebraska Mid-Aug-1867 Leonard G. Rice About 500 About 50 5-Oct-1867 No pioneer company roster. See ship roster of the Manhattan for list of those most likely in this company.

"The steamship Manhattan sailed from Liverpool, England, with 480 Saints, under the direction of Archibald Hill.

It arrived in New York July 4th and the emigrates continued the journey to North Platte, a station on the

Union Pacific Railroad, 391 miles west of Omaha. From that place the journey across the plains was commenced,

Aug. 8th, with ox-teams under the direction of Capt. Leonard G. Rice, and the company arrived in G.S.L City Oct. 5."

Church Chronology June 21, 1867
